title: 關聖帝君一百籤第十一籤
subtitle: 韓信功勞不久乙甲

analysis.zh: 這首詩的主題是關於在繁華與吉祥背後隱藏的變幻與危險，提醒人們勿被表面光彩迷惑。第一句說明今年將迎來新的好事，表面似乎充滿機遇；第二句則指出富貴榮華已聚於身邊，形容成功與財運不斷聚集。然而第三句透露「誰道機關難料處」，暗示背後的因緣與變化難以預測；最後一句「到頭獨立轉傷神」更強調在孤立無援時，事態往往逆轉，導致精神與身體受損。整體而言，詩句強調謹慎行事、保持內斂，以免被臨時得利所惑，最終失去原有的安寧與健康。此籤詩亦提醒在追求外在成功之際，須保守內心平衡，避免因孤立而失去支持與資源，從而保持身心之安寧。
analysis.en: The theme of this poem is the hidden volatility and danger that lie beneath apparent prosperity and auspiciousness, warning people not to be deceived by surface brilliance. The first line says that this year will bring new good fortune, seemingly full of opportunities. The second line points out that wealth and glory have gathered around you, describing continuous success and financial accumulation. However, the third line reveals "who says mechanisms are difficult to predict," hinting that the underlying causes and changes are hard to foresee. The final line "at the end, standing alone turns into harm to the spirit" emphasizes that when isolated and unsupported, circumstances often reverse, damaging mental and physical well-being. Overall, the poem stresses cautious action and inner restraint to avoid being fooled by fleeting gains, ultimately losing original peace and health. This charm also reminds that while pursuing external success, one must preserve inner balance, avoiding loss of support and resources when isolated, thereby maintaining physical and mental tranquility.
analysis.jp: この詩の主題は、見た目の繁栄や吉兆の裏に潜む変幻と危険であり、外見の輝きに騙されないよう人々に警告することです。最初の句は、今年が新たな幸運をもたらすと述べ、機会が豊富にあるように思えます。2番目の句は、富と栄華があなたの周りに集まっていることを指摘し、継続的な成功と財運の蓄積を描写します。 しかし、3番目の句は「誰が機関が難しいと予測するのか」と明らかにし、裏側の原因と変化が予測しにくいことを示唆しています。 最後の句「終わりに独立すると精神に害をもたらす」は、孤立し支援を欠くときに状況が逆転し、精神的・肉体的な損傷を招くことを強調します。 全体として、この詩は、衝動的な利益に騙されず、元の平穏と健康を失わないように慎重な行動と内面的な抑制を強調しています。 この詩は、外部の成功を追求する際に、孤立したときに支援や資源を失わないよう、内面のバランスを保ち、身体と精神の安寧を維持するよう促しています。
analysis.reference: 漢韓信。准陰人。佐漢高帝定天下。虜魏。破趙。降燕。下齊。滅楚。建十大功勳。初封楚王。高祖深忌其能。後偽遊雲夢。執歸降。封淮陰侯。乃不自損抑。務伐己功。致有殺身赤族之禍。亡年僅三十二歲。雖有功勞。不久於世。

rag_analysis: Rag_analysis: This charm speaks of the juxtaposition between apparent prosperity and the hidden volatility that can reverse fortunes. The first line announces that this year will bring new good fortune, seemingly full of opportunities. The second line indicates that wealth and glory have gathered around you, describing continuous success and financial accumulation. The third line reveals "who says mechanisms are difficult to predict," hinting that underlying causes and changes are hard to foresee. The final line "at the end, standing alone turns into harm to the spirit" emphasizes that when isolated and unsupported, circumstances often reverse, damaging mental and physical well-being. Overall, the poem stresses cautious action and inner restraint to avoid being fooled by fleeting gains, thereby preserving original peace and health. The charm also reminds seekers of external success to maintain inner balance, avoiding loss of support and resources when isolated, and thus preserving physical and mental tranquility.
